item.title: Constant Domestic Dumping Fingal St and Chilver St SE10, 28th September
item.description:
Domestic dumping at these location occurs on an almost daily basis. It must drive the street sweepers mad as foxes and other animals rip them apart and strew the contents everywhere. Time to start tracking down the culprits.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 131, Woolwich Road, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Collapsed electrical cable onto Sycamore Close approach road, 28th September
item.description:
Recently someone has torn from the wall a sealed end ( see yellow covering) of an length of heavy duty electrical cabling. Maybe or may not be live. Even if not it is unsightly and dangerous as road is used by elderly residents, their visitors and others an is adjacent to child play group centre.

item.title: Uneven road surfaces - houses shake violently when cars pass fast, 28th September
item.description:
At the junction of Rochdale Road and Bostall Hill, nearby houses shake noticeably whenever vehicles pass at speed, particularly larger ones. The problem is most severe at night, when cars tend to travel much faster, and on several occasions our family has been woken by the vibrations. We moved into the area less than a year ago, but in recent months the issue has clearly worsened — the shaking has become more pronounced whenever vehicles pass. On inspecting the road, I noticed that the surface appears uneven, which may be contributing to the problem. I have also observed that cars and larger vehicles often wobble from side to side when passing over this section, suggesting that the uneven road surface is affecting stability.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochdale Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Politically motivated messaging, 28th September
item.description:
To whomever it may concern, Thank you for your notice on your web-page stating you will not be removing the national flags raised across the borough; nonetheless I would like to draw your attention to those raised directly outside Birkbeck Primary school, (Faraday entrance). Birkbeck is a local community primary school, populated by a diverse community of families. The school teaches and practices the fundamental values of respect, equality and inclusion. I believe the current 'trend' of raising national flags is politically motivated, divisive, inflammatory and contravenes the core values of the school. I would encourage the council to reflect and remove the flags from this setting, (at the very least). Every parent, carer, staff member and child has the right to feel safe in their school community. The proximity of the flags to the school does engender this environment. I attach two photos; taken inside and outside of the school. I would appreciate a response to the above. Many thanks Jenny

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Faraday Avenue, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedge is an eyesore and damaging structures, 28th September
item.description:
I reported this hedge already, two gentleman came to cut it and have left it half done and an eye saw. The wall is getting more damage to it which will either damage a car or someone walking past. The landlord doesn’t want it cut down completely for ‘sentimental’ reasons according to the two gentleman who came to cut it down.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayfield Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
